result.execSummary:
The defendant Christian J. Correa was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Christian J. Correa is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Christian J. Correa was found guilty of Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Christian J. Correa was found guilty of Criminal Damage to Property (Over $2500) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(2)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent. 
** Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  Submit a DNA sample (unless previously provided).
** Pay DNA surcharge (unless previously paid).
** Pay restitution plus surcharges.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney L Walker.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  On ct 2 the court imposes a total sentence of 7 years WSP concurrent to 10CF540; 3 years initial confinement w/credit for 136 days served; 4 years extended supervision w/conditions; on ct 4 the court imposes a total sentence of 3 1/2 years WSP concurrent to ct 2 and to 10CF540; 18 months initial confinement w/credit for 136 days served; 2 years extended supervision w/conditions; deft is eligible for CIP/SAP; restitution ordered in the amount of $4,069.36 (by stipulation of deft); deft to submit DNA sample and pay $500 DNA surcharge.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Laura Walker.  Clerk: PT
Case is resolved and parties will be stipulating to restitution.  Counts 2 & 4 - DE pleads Guilty; found guilty by the Court.  Counts 1 & 3 - Dismissed by the State.  PSI ordered for Sentencing on 10/30/15 at 10:00 AM.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.
